project.tags: html docbook openlaszlo sources xslt
project.text: html2db 2004 laszlo systems, inc. html2db.xsl converts an xhtml source document into a docbook output document. it provides features for customizing the generation of the output, so that the output can be tuned by annotating the source, rather than hand-editing the output. this makes it useful in a processing pipeline where the source documents are maintained in html, although it can be used as a one-time conversion tool too. this was written as part of the openlaszlo doc pipeline. html docbook openlaszlo sources xslt
project.name: html2db

project.tags: online openlaszlo website major platform flash ajax ria active sources java javascript python
project.text: openlaszlo platform 2001-2005 laszlo systems, inc. i am the chief software architect, was responsible for the xml tag language design, wrote the initial tag and xml compiler, and lead the teams that wrote the compiler and developed the open source release. an open source platform for creating zero-install web applications with the user interface capabilities of desktop client software. online openlaszlo website major platform flash ajax ria active sources java javascript python flash
project.name: OpenLaszlo Platform

project.tags: wordpress php sources
project.text: wp-static-preview 2004 static-preview.php allows you to preview files that you edit on your server s filesystem, without storing them in the wordpress database. it is intended for the case where you have access to the file system of your web server or a staging server capable of running php. it allows you to use a text editor such as emacs to edit a file in one window and preview the results in another window. this gives you more full-featured editing than the web browser, and a faster edit-preview workflow cycle than copying between a text editor and and the wordpress writing web form. wordpress php sources php
project.name: wp-static-preview

project.tags: online historical macos graphics java applet c assembly
project.text: frost and fire 1999 a program that simulated video feedback. i licensed this as a screen saver for after dark. this technique is now a staple of media player audio visualizations. online historical macos graphics java applet java c assembly
project.name: Frost and Fire

project.tags: macintosh academic force-feedback c
project.text: sandpaper 1989-1991 a test bed for manipulating virtual textures, haptically rendered with a force-feedback joystick. this was my wife s thesis work; i created the software system. macintosh academic force-feedback c
project.name: Sandpaper

project.tags: historical macintosh hypertext pascal
project.text: storyspace 1987 riverrun storyspace was a hypertext authoring and viewing environment, before the web. i implemented a hypertext text editor for it.the company and program still exist; i would be amazed (and horrified) if it still used any of my code. historical macintosh hypertext pascal
project.name: Storyspace

project.tags: online macintosh java applet c
project.text: tiles 1989 using duals to tile the plane with octagons, pentagons, and other interesting patterns. i originally implemented this as a macintosh program; the version here is a more recent port to java. online macintosh java applet c java
project.name: Tiles

project.tags: online historical macintosh c assembly
project.text: ancient macintosh programs 1984-1989 menu editor was a wysiwyg tool for editing macos menus. menu madness was an investigation some alternate styles for macos menu layout and appearance. spheres was a port of the sun screen saver to macos. dragger was a startup extension (init) that implemented solid and translucent window dragging. tiles and truchet were mathematical visualizations. online historical macintosh c assembly
project.name: Ancient Macintosh Programs

project.tags: online historical commodore-64 game assembly
